# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your request:
```julia
function wrap_string(input::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input, " ")
    lines = String[]
    
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line) # add the remaining line
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
You can use this function like so:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit"))
```
This will output:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit 
amet consectetur
adipiscing elit
```
